description: Length of Roman notation for n = length of decimal representation.
links: Nathaniel Johnston, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..144 (complete up to 3999)
example: 15 = XV has length 2 in both notations.
maple: for n from 1 to 3999 do if(length(convert(n, roman)) = length(n))then printf("%d, ", n): fi: od: # Nathaniel Johnston, May 18 2011
prog: (Haskell)a036787 n = a036787_list !! (n-1)a036787_list = [x | x <- [1..], a006968 x == a055642 x]-- _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Apr 20 2013(PARI) is_A036787(n)=#Str(n)==#Str(A061493(n)) \\ _M. F. Hasler_, Jan 12 2015
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_.
extensions: Corrected and extended by Larry Reeves (larryr(AT)acm.org), Sep 25 2000
